title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 65.9 - Interpreters
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 65.9 - Interpreters

State Regulations
(a) If a party or
witness requires an interpreter at any stage of the proceeding, an interpreter
will be provided by the Board upon a party's request. Interpreters are provided
at no cost to the parties, except as provided for in paragraph (c) of this
section. (b) The Board may
establish reasonable deadlines for the parties to make a request for an
interpreter. (c) The Board may
direct a party to pay the reasonable costs incurred by the Board caused by a
party's failure to request an interpreter by the deadline set by the Board if
such untimely request causes an adjournment or unnecessary delay. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
65.9

Adopted

New

York State Register March 30, 2022/Volume XLIV, Issue 13, eff. 3/30/2022

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
